Events.html: 800 – Charlemagne judges the accusations against Pope Leo III in the Vatican.
Events.text: Charlemagne judges the accusations against Pope Leo III in the Vatican.

Events.html: 1420 – Henry V of England enters Paris.
Events.text: Henry V of England enters Paris.

Events.html: 1577 – Francis Walsingham is knighted.
Events.text: Francis Walsingham is knighted.

Events.html: 1640 – End of the Iberian Union: Portugal acclaims as King João IV of Portugal, ending 60 years of personal union of the crowns of Portugal and Spain and the end of the rule of the Philippine Dynasty.
Events.text: End of the Iberian Union: Portugal acclaims as King João IV of Portugal, ending 60 years of personal union of the crowns of Portugal and Spain and the end of the rule of the Philippine Dynasty.

Events.html: 1768 – The former slave ship Fredensborg sinks off Tromøy in Norway.
Events.text: The former slave ship Fredensborg sinks off Tromøy in Norway.

Events.html: 1822 – Peter I is crowned Emperor of Brazil.
Events.text: Peter I is crowned Emperor of Brazil.

Events.html: 1824 – United States presidential election, 1824: Since no candidate received a majority of the total electoral college votes in the election, the United States House of Representatives is given the task of deciding the winner in accordance with the Twelfth Amendment to the United States Constitution.
Events.text: United States presidential election, 1824: Since no candidate received a majority of the total electoral college votes in the election, the United States House of Representatives is given the task of deciding the winner in accordance with the Twelfth Amendment to the United States Constitution.

links.subject: Twelfth Amendment to the United States Constitution
links.title: Twelfth Amendment to the United States Constitution

Events.html: 1826 – French philhellene Charles Nicolas Fabvier forces his way through the Turkish cordon and ascends the Acropolis of Athens, which had been under siege.
Events.text: French philhellene Charles Nicolas Fabvier forces his way through the Turkish cordon and ascends the Acropolis of Athens, which had been under siege.

Events.html: 1828 – Argentine general Juan Lavalle makes a coup against governor Manuel Dorrego, beginning the Decembrist revolution.
Events.text: Argentine general Juan Lavalle makes a coup against governor Manuel Dorrego, beginning the Decembrist revolution.

Events.html: 1834 – Slavery is abolished in the Cape Colony in accordance with the Slavery Abolition Act 1833.
Events.text: Slavery is abolished in the Cape Colony in accordance with the Slavery Abolition Act 1833.

Events.html: 1862 – In his State of the Union Address President Abraham Lincoln reaffirms the necessity of ending slavery as ordered ten weeks earlier in the Emancipation Proclamation.
Events.text: In his State of the Union Address President Abraham Lincoln reaffirms the necessity of ending slavery as ordered ten weeks earlier in the Emancipation Proclamation.

Events.html: 1864 – Great Fire of Brisbane
Events.text: Great Fire of Brisbane

Events.html: 1865 – Shaw University, the first historically black university in the southern United States, is founded in Raleigh, North Carolina.
Events.text: Shaw University, the first historically black university in the southern United States, is founded in Raleigh, North Carolina.

Events.html: 1885 – First serving of the soft drink Dr Pepper at a drug store in Waco, Texas.
Events.text: First serving of the soft drink Dr Pepper at a drug store in Waco, Texas.

Events.html: 1913 – The Buenos Aires Metro, the first underground railway system in the Southern Hemisphere and in Latin America, begins operation.
Events.text: The Buenos Aires Metro, the first underground railway system in the Southern Hemisphere and in Latin America, begins operation.

Events.html: 1913 – The Ford Motor Company introduces the first moving assembly line.
Events.text: The Ford Motor Company introduces the first moving assembly line.

Events.html: 1913 – Crete, having obtained self rule from Turkey after the First Balkan War, is annexed by Greece.
Events.text: Crete, having obtained self rule from Turkey after the First Balkan War, is annexed by Greece.

Events.html: 1918 – Transylvania unites with the Kingdom of Romania, following the incorporation of Bessarabia (March 27) and Bukovina (November 28), thus concluding the Great Union.
Events.text: Transylvania unites with the Kingdom of Romania, following the incorporation of Bessarabia (March 27) and Bukovina (November 28), thus concluding the Great Union.

Events.html: 1918 – The Kingdom of Iceland becomes a sovereign state, yet remains a part of the Danish kingdom.
Events.text: The Kingdom of Iceland becomes a sovereign state, yet remains a part of the Danish kingdom.

Events.html: 1918 – The Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes (later known as the Kingdom of Yugoslavia) is proclaimed.
Events.text: The Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes (later known as the Kingdom of Yugoslavia) is proclaimed.

Events.html: 1919 – Lady Astor becomes the first female Member of Parliament to take her seat in the House of Commons of the United Kingdom. (She had been elected to that position on November 28.)
Events.text: Lady Astor becomes the first female Member of Parliament to take her seat in the House of Commons of the United Kingdom. (She had been elected to that position on November 28.)

links.subject: House of Commons of the United Kingdom
links.title: House of Commons of the United Kingdom

Events.html: 1919 – The first issue of Diário de Noite is published from Goa.
Events.text: The first issue of Diário de Noite is published from Goa.

Events.html: 1934 – In the Soviet Union, Politburo member Sergey Kirov is shot dead by Leonid Nikolaev at the Communist Party headquarters in Leningrad.
Events.text: In the Soviet Union, Politburo member Sergey Kirov is shot dead by Leonid Nikolaev at the Communist Party headquarters in Leningrad.

links.subject: Communist Party
links.title: Communist Party of the Soviet Union

Events.html: 1941 – World War II: Emperor Hirohito of Japan gives the final approval to initiate war against the United States.
Events.text: World War II: Emperor Hirohito of Japan gives the final approval to initiate war against the United States.

Events.html: 1941 – World War II: Fiorello La Guardia, Mayor of New York City and Director of the Office of Civilian Defense, signs Administrative Order 9, creating the Civil Air Patrol.
Events.text: World War II: Fiorello La Guardia, Mayor of New York City and Director of the Office of Civilian Defense, signs Administrative Order 9, creating the Civil Air Patrol.

Events.html: 1948 – Taman Shud Case: The body of an unidentified man is found in Adelaide, Australia, involving an undetectable poison and a secret code in a very rare book; the case remains unsolved and is "one of Australia's most profound mysteries."
Events.text: Taman Shud Case: The body of an unidentified man is found in Adelaide, Australia, involving an undetectable poison and a secret code in a very rare book; the case remains unsolved and is "one of Australia's most profound mysteries."

Events.html: 1952 – The New York Daily News reports the news of Christine Jorgensen, the first notable case of sexual reassignment surgery.
Events.text: The New York Daily News reports the news of Christine Jorgensen, the first notable case of sexual reassignment surgery.

Events.html: 1955 – American Civil Rights Movement: In Montgomery, Alabama, seamstress Rosa Parks refuses to give up her bus seat to a white man and is arrested for violating the city's racial segregation laws, an incident which leads to the Montgomery Bus Boycott.
Events.text: American Civil Rights Movement: In Montgomery, Alabama, seamstress Rosa Parks refuses to give up her bus seat to a white man and is arrested for violating the city's racial segregation laws, an incident which leads to the Montgomery Bus Boycott.

Events.html: 1958 – The Central African Republic attains self-rule within the French Union.
Events.text: The Central African Republic attains self-rule within the French Union.

Events.html: 1958 – The Our Lady of the Angels School fire in Chicago kills 92 children and three nuns.
Events.text: The Our Lady of the Angels School fire in Chicago kills 92 children and three nuns.

links.subject: Our Lady of the Angels School fire
links.title: Our Lady of the Angels School fire

Events.html: 1959 – Cold War: Opening date for signature of the Antarctic Treaty, which sets aside Antarctica as a scientific preserve and bans military activity on the continent.
Events.text: Cold War: Opening date for signature of the Antarctic Treaty, which sets aside Antarctica as a scientific preserve and bans military activity on the continent.

Events.html: 1960 – Paul McCartney and Pete Best are arrested (and later deported) from Hamburg, Germany, after accusations of attempted arson.
Events.text: Paul McCartney and Pete Best are arrested (and later deported) from Hamburg, Germany, after accusations of attempted arson.

Events.html: 1963 – Nagaland becomes the 16th state of India.
Events.text: Nagaland becomes the 16th state of India.

Events.html: 1964 – Vietnam War: U.S. President Lyndon B. Johnson and his top-ranking advisers meet to discuss plans to bomb North Vietnam.
Events.text: Vietnam War: U.S. President Lyndon B. Johnson and his top-ranking advisers meet to discuss plans to bomb North Vietnam.

Events.html: 1964 – Malawi, Malta and Zambia join the United Nations.
Events.text: Malawi, Malta and Zambia join the United Nations.

Events.html: 1965 – India's Border Security Force is established.
Events.text: India's Border Security Force is established.

Events.html: 1966 – The first Gävle goat, an annual Swedish Yule Goat tradition, is erected in Gävle.
Events.text: The first Gävle goat, an annual Swedish Yule Goat tradition, is erected in Gävle.

Events.html: 1969 – Vietnam War: The first draft lottery in the United States is held since World War II.
Events.text: Vietnam War: The first draft lottery in the United States is held since World War II.

Events.html: 1971 – Cambodian Civil War: Khmer Rouge rebels intensify assaults on Cambodian government positions, forcing their retreat from Kompong Thmar and nearby Ba Ray.
Events.text: Cambodian Civil War: Khmer Rouge rebels intensify assaults on Cambodian government positions, forcing their retreat from Kompong Thmar and nearby Ba Ray.

Events.html: 1973 – Papua New Guinea gains self-governance from Australia.
Events.text: Papua New Guinea gains self-governance from Australia.

Events.html: 1974 – TWA Flight 514, a Boeing 727, crashes northwest of Dulles International Airport, killing all 92 people on board.
Events.text: TWA Flight 514, a Boeing 727, crashes northwest of Dulles International Airport, killing all 92 people on board.

Events.html: 1974 – Northwest Orient Airlines Flight 6231, another Boeing 727, crashes northwest of John F. Kennedy International Airport.
Events.text: Northwest Orient Airlines Flight 6231, another Boeing 727, crashes northwest of John F. Kennedy International Airport.

Events.html: 1976 – Angola joins the United Nations.
Events.text: Angola joins the United Nations.

Events.html: 1981 – Inex-Adria Aviopromet Flight 1308, a McDonnell Douglas MD-80, crashes in Corsica, killing all 180 people on board.
Events.text: Inex-Adria Aviopromet Flight 1308, a McDonnell Douglas MD-80, crashes in Corsica, killing all 180 people on board.

Events.html: 1984 – NASA conducts the Controlled Impact Demonstration, wherein an airliner is deliberately crashed in order to test technologies and gather data to help improve survivability of crashes.
Events.text: NASA conducts the Controlled Impact Demonstration, wherein an airliner is deliberately crashed in order to test technologies and gather data to help improve survivability of crashes.

Events.html: 1988 – Benazir Bhutto is appointed Prime Minister of Pakistan.
Events.text: Benazir Bhutto is appointed Prime Minister of Pakistan.

Events.html: 1989 – Philippine coup attempt: The right-wing military rebel Reform the Armed Forces Movement attempts to oust Philippine President Corazon Aquino in a failed bloody coup d'état.
Events.text: Philippine coup attempt: The right-wing military rebel Reform the Armed Forces Movement attempts to oust Philippine President Corazon Aquino in a failed bloody coup d'état.

Events.html: 1989 – Cold War: East Germany's parliament abolishes the constitutional provision granting the Communist Party the leading role in the state.
Events.text: Cold War: East Germany's parliament abolishes the constitutional provision granting the Communist Party the leading role in the state.

Events.html: 1990 – Channel Tunnel sections started from the United Kingdom and France meet 40 metres beneath the seabed.
Events.text: Channel Tunnel sections started from the United Kingdom and France meet 40 metres beneath the seabed.

Events.html: 1991 – Cold War: Ukrainian voters overwhelmingly approve a referendum for independence from the Soviet Union.
Events.text: Cold War: Ukrainian voters overwhelmingly approve a referendum for independence from the Soviet Union.

Events.html: 1997 – In the Indian state of Bihar, Ranvir Sena attacked the CPI(ML) Party Unity stronghold Lakshmanpur-Bathe, killing 63 lower caste people.
Events.text: In the Indian state of Bihar, Ranvir Sena attacked the CPI(ML) Party Unity stronghold Lakshmanpur-Bathe, killing 63 lower caste people.

links.subject: CPI(ML) Party Unity
links.title: Central Organising Committee, Communist Party of India (Marxist–Leninist) Party Unity

Events.html: 2001 – Captain Bill Compton brings Trans World Airlines Flight 220, an MD-83, into St. Louis International Airport bringing to an end 76 years of TWA operations following TWA's purchase by American Airlines.
Events.text: Captain Bill Compton brings Trans World Airlines Flight 220, an MD-83, into St. Louis International Airport bringing to an end 76 years of TWA operations following TWA's purchase by American Airlines.

Events.html: 2009 – The Treaty of Lisbon, which amends the Treaty on European Union and the Treaty establishing the European Community, which together comprise the constitutional basis of European Union, comes into effect.
Events.text: The Treaty of Lisbon, which amends the Treaty on European Union and the Treaty establishing the European Community, which together comprise the constitutional basis of European Union, comes into effect.

Events.html: 2013 – China launches Yutu or Jade Rabbit, its first lunar rover, as part of the Chang'e 3 lunar exploration mission.
Events.text: China launches Yutu or Jade Rabbit, its first lunar rover, as part of the Chang'e 3 lunar exploration mission.

Events.html: 2013 – A derailment of a Metro-North Railroad train near Spuyten Duyvil, Bronx, New York City kills four and injures 61.
Events.text: A derailment of a Metro-North Railroad train near Spuyten Duyvil, Bronx, New York City kills four and injures 61.
